Class Shooter

java.lang.Object
  




public class Shooter
extends greenfoot.Actor

Creates a shooter that shoots projectiles at a specified frequency depending on the pokemon type. They find the object closest to them to shoot and rotate to face that object.

Version:
June 2018
Author:
Amber, Maggie

          Decreases the shoot timer and shoots when the timer reaches 0, then resets.
 void shoot()
          Shoots at the closest enemy in the direction of the enemy.

Constructor Detail

Shooter

public Shooter(char whichPokemon)
Constructor for the Shooters. Sets all the images depending on the type of pokemon.

Parameters:
whichPokemon - Character used to differentiate between pokemon. b:bulbasaur i:ivysaur v:venusaur s:squirtle w:wartortle B:blastoise r:charmander n:charmelion d:charizard
Method Detail

act

public void act()
Run every time act or run is pressed. Will rotate shooter to the nearest enemy so they shoot, and adjusts the image accordingly.

Overrides:
act in class greenfoot.Actor

getWhichPokemon

public char getWhichPokemon()
Getter method that returns the pokemon.

Returns:
char Character of the pokemon shooter. b:bulbasaur i:ivysaur v:venusaur s:squirtle w:wartortle B:blastoise r:charmander n:charmelion d:charizard

healthActorAct

public void healthActorAct()
Decreases the shoot timer and shoots when the timer reaches 0, then resets.

shoot

public void shoot()
Shoots at the closest enemy in the direction of the enemy.
